title: Auto-filled players should lose less LP in losses and gain more in wins
body:
It already sucks to have to play something I didn't even want to, but to have to lose the same amount of LP is just kicking me when I'm down. So why not lose only half the amount of LP in losses (like 50%), and win a bit more than normal (like 150%) in wins. It would at least provide some additional incentive to compensate the crappy role placement.

_Edit: I Know that pre-season 6, it was more or less auto-fill for every game. But since season 6, everyone more or less got use to playing only 2-3 roles and avoided 1-2 of them. This meant that players didn't have to stay current with the 5 various metas around play styles and "what/who currently is the best" in every role. Especially with the many Jungle changes, item changes, and "class updates" that happened throughout season 6._

My having to play support is not why I quit playing, it is because it takes a half hour or more to get into a match because autofilled players queue dodge.  I like playing the game, not playing the lobby ban phase over and over again.

The reason they introduced role queue in the first place was to reduce the number of queue dodges, now they have a system that fights itself.

Beside all of that, do you want a weak support on your team who does not know how to ward river, the timing of the skills on their champ and so on?  I played several thousand normal games in support, top, and jungle before I went into ranked with those roles.  If I get out in ADC by autofill at some point it will likely be an auto loss for my team.

 In short, a team is only as strong as its weakest link, that weakest link will often be the autofilled player.  I do not enjoy playing a game where the choices are out of our hands and left to chance.  Autofill is RNG, there is already enough of that in the game with crit.

Autofill is not RNG if you know how to "abuse it".
If you queue as support, your next 4 games will be "autofill protected", which means you can't get autofilled and you will get your primary or secondary role.
If everyone did this, nobody would ever get autofilled and there would be enough supports for near instant queues

We cannot tell whether an enemy is autofilled or not, but either way, it is all random chance, which is unhealthy for a game really (thus why they took out things like dodge mechanism).

So. . .    as I said, autofill is a problem on a magnitude that cannot be stated often or clearly enough.  Once you start caring about winning at all you do not want to put yourself at the mercy of chance, especially when one could easily track the number of autofill games and start to calculate the losses of players involved in matches where autofill took place.  It will be higher by a large enough percentage to cause issues, the system is flawed, designed to fix long queue times, at the expense of the quality of the matches, and thus the fun of the game, the same can really be said of the MMR system as well, but it's been around and ingrained for so long now that it cannot really be removed or changed without irreparable damage to the system as a whole.
